page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN THE LYTHE AREA
page.content: {EMPLOYMENT:- Since the decline of the alum industry employment has largely depended upon agricultre and to a lesser extent tourism. 40% of the working population work on Mulgrave Estate in a variety of ways-household staff,management,office employees,gamekeepers,gardeners, herds men,and other agricultural workers. 28% of the workers travel to Whitby to work as shop workers etc.. 21% work in the village in a self employed capacity. 2% work at the Boulby Potash mine. 7% work completely away from the area and leave the village for long periods.
